Key Match Events: Joel Embiid shot 2-for-11 from the field in his first game, finishing with 13 points.
Paul George scored a game-high 29 points for his best game as a Sixer.
New York went on a 13-0 run to take an 89-75 lead with 8:14 to play.
Paul George finished with 29 points, 10 rebounds, three assists, three steals, a block, and four turnovers.
Rookie guard Jared McCain had another solid scoring night, finishing with 23 points on 7-for-16 shooting.
OG Anunoby led the Knicks with 24 points.
Karl-Anthony Towns added 21 points, 13 rebounds, and six assists.
Josh Hart finished with 14 points, 12 rebounds, and 10 assists.
Post-Match Reflections: Joel Embiid expressed that it felt good playing with Paul George for the first time and emphasized making the game easier for his teammates.
Jared McCain mentioned the importance of making oneself open and taking advantage of the attention on Joel Embiid.
